meanings.definition: To separate or set apart from others.
meanings.sent1: In the classroom, the teacher will segregate the students into groups for a project.
meanings.sent2: The laundry room has separate bins to segregate whites and colors.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater would segregate all the green vegetables to one side of his plate.
meanings.sent4: The magician used a special trick to segregate the red scarf from the rest of the colors.
meanings.sent5: To keep the peace, the playground monitor had to segregate the arguing kids.

meanings.definition: To isolate or divide based on race, religion, or other factors.
meanings.sent1: During the civil rights movement, many people fought against the laws that would segregate communities.
meanings.sent2: Some countries have a history of segregating people based on their beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The aliens in the movie tried to segregate humans from their alien friends for a funny experiment.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to segregate the two towns, each on its own side of the water.
meanings.sent5: The high wall was built to segregate the noisy factory from the quiet neighborhood.
